title: How Can the Government ‘Take Back’ a City It Largely Controls?
summary: President Trump and his allies have berated Washington, D.C., officials. Yet the federal government has often made it harder for those officials to manage the capital.

title: Troops in Washington Remain Largely Unseen So Far
summary: Federal agents are assisting the local police, but a surge in National Guard troops hasn’t hit the streets.

title: D.C. Police Move to Share Limited Information With Federal Immigration Officials
summary: Chief Pamela A. Smith’s order effectively serves as a carve-out to how the department enforces a broader ban that prohibits the local police from cooperating with federal immigration enforcement.

title: Russia Seeks to Add Trade and Arms Control Into Trump-Putin Talks
summary: Over recent months, the Kremlin has been trying to move the diplomatic focus away from Ukraine to bilateral issues, such as trade and strategic stability.

title: Why Does Trump Want to Meet With Putin, and What Are the Risks?
summary: President Trump wants to be seen as a peacemaker, but the meeting comes with enormous stakes.

title: The Auctioneer and the Treasury Chief: Billy Long’s Quick Fall at the I.R.S.
summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent sought total control over the I.R.S., an agency where Mr. Long, the new commissioner, had started to put his own mark on the job.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Set to Hit Ireland, Where Drugmakers Play Tax Games
summary: Manufacturing in Ireland has long helped many American drug companies pay lower taxes. But that strategy was designed for a world without President Trump’s tariffs.

title: There’s Money to Be Made From ‘MAHA.’ Food Companies Want In.
summary: Processed-food giants and produce growers are tweaking products and ads to reach the Make America Healthy Again movement. But the strategy carries risks.

title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Epstein Defenses
summary: In the face of mounting discontent over his administration’s handling of the Jeffrey Epstein files, President Trump has turned to deflection, denial and downplaying.

title: A Timeline of What We Know About Trump and Epstein
summary: Donald Trump was friendly for at least 15 years with Jeffrey Epstein, the multimillionaire financier and convicted sex offender who died in jail in 2019.

title: He Was Lost. Could a Shooting Range Like Thunder Ranch Help Him Find Himself?
summary: Thunder Ranch is one of the best-known shooting schools in American gun culture, offering firearms as a way to change your life when all else fails.

title: Does Earning $142,000 in New York City Make You Rich?
summary: Andrew Cuomo is basing his new line of attack against Zohran Mamdani on a certain definition of wealth. But the reality is complicated.

title: Plan to Add 9,500 Homes to Midtown Expected to Get City Council Approval
summary: The plan would open a swath of Manhattan, including the garment district, to residential development.

title: Israeli Settlers Unleash Record High Attacks in West Bank
summary: Extremists are carrying out one of the most violent campaigns against Palestinian villages since the U.N. began keeping records.

title: Israel Says More Aid Is Entering Gaza, but Relief Groups Warn of Bottlenecking
summary: Israel says its has allowed more aid into Gaza in recent days, and food prices are dropping, but humanitarian groups warn it is not enough.

title: What It Takes to Find Food in Gaza
summary: Starvation has spread in Gaza, as the prices of basic goods have skyrocketed and getting aid is difficult and often deadly. Ashley Wu, a graphics reporter for The New York Times, explains the dire choices that many Gazans face, as Israel faces growing condemnation over the crisis.

title: Toronto Film Festival Cancels Screenings of Israeli Documentary About Oct. 7 Attack
summary: The event’s organizers said the producers of the film, which includes footage of atrocities recorded by Hamas fighters during the attack, had failed to obtain the rights to the videos.

title: Syria Violence in March Amounts to War Crimes, U.N. Report Says
summary: An inquiry found that members of the new government’s forces took part in killing Syrian civilians during sectarian fighting in March, but found no evidence that they acted on government orders.

title: Big Tech’s A.I. Data Centers Are Driving Up Electricity Bills for Everyone
summary: Electricity rates for individuals and small businesses could rise sharply as Amazon, Google, Microsoft and other technology companies build data centers and expand into the energy business.

title: Taylor Swift Found a New Way to Control Her Narrative: Podcasts
summary: For stars promoting their projects, podcasts have become an appealing alternative to late-night TV and glossy magazines.

title: Taylor Swift and Drake Promote Albums on Podcasts in Media Landscape Shift
summary: The two megastars recently sat for hourslong video conversations on streaming platforms, but took different approaches to what they revealed.

title: For Some Patients, the ‘Inner Voice’ May Soon Be Audible
summary: In a recent study, scientists successfully decoded not only the words people tried to say but the words they merely imagined saying.

title: Revisiting Carrie Bradshaw’s Apartments in ‘Sex and the City’ and ‘And Just Like That’
summary: The end of “And Just Like That …” means the end of a real estate portfolio that includes a cozy Upper East Side studio and a grand Gramercy townhouse.

title: Crime Keeps Falling. Here’s Why.
summary: Reflections on social cohesion and law enforcement can help policymakers reduce crime even further.

title: Abolish the Senate. End the Electoral College. Pack the Court.
summary: Why the left can’t win without a new Constitution.

title: How Cryptocurrency Could Be Coming for Your Bank Account
summary: We explain the benefits and the risks.

title: Judge Orders Liquidation of Infowars to Pay Sandy Hook Families
summary: The order comes after a series of legal setbacks for the families of Sandy Hook victims as they tried to collect money owed to them by the conspiracy theorist Alex Jones.

title: A Solution to the C.I.A.’s ‘Kryptos’ Sculpture Goes Up for Auction
summary: Sleuths have solved three of the panels of the Kryptos sculpture at the agency’s headquarters. Now the artwork’s creator is announcing the sale of the solution to the fourth.

title: Man Who Faked His Death and Fled to Scotland Is Convicted of Rape
summary: Nicholas Rossi lived for years as a fugitive before being extradited. A jury in Utah found him guilty of a 2008 sexual assault.

title: Echoes of Old Walls Appear, Briefly, in Britain’s Arid Soil
summary: Unusually dry conditions are revealing the outlines of old walls at British historical sites. Climate change is making the lines, called “parchmarks,” more frequently visible.
